My favourite game of all time by far

The gameplay is for the most part fair and balanced *Cough* Random Crits *Cough* and there is always something new to learn that keeps the game fresh. It does have a semi steep learning curve at first which if you really wanted to you could just avoid and play classes that are easier to get a grip on, but once you get the hang of it you'll keep coming back for more. Definitely recommend it to anybody looking for a fun game.

abi çok iyi bir oyun ya tf2 arkadaşlarınızla oynamak için inanılmaz bir oyun hemen geçelim anlatmaya oyunu indirmeye yönelen arkadaşlar bi baksın yoruma 
----------------------------------
şimdik oyunda 9 tane class var bunlar
Pyro
Medic
Spy
Sniper
Scout
Heavy
Soldier
engineer(adını yazamadım sanırım :D)
demomen 
şimdide özelliklerinden bahsedelim
pyro=alev silahı var ve püskürtme özelliği var yakarak zarar veriyor.
medic=adı gibi sadece iyileştirmeye yönelik bir karakter ama zararda verebiliyor
spy=tamamen gizlilik üzerine bir karakter ve karşı takımın kılığına girip onlar gibi davranıp onları arkadan bıçaklayan bir karakter.
sniper=keskin nışancı tüfeği ile rakiplerin beynine mermiyi döşüyen benim favori karakterim sniper
scout=beyzbol sopası ve pompalı tüfeğiyle şimşek gibi koşan çift zıplayan adamları bezdiren bir karakter 
heavy=I am Heavy Weapons Guy yeterli.(youtube da Meet With Heavy yazın anlarsınız ne demek istediğimi :D)
soldier=roket atarı ile zıplayan psikopat amerika askeri 
engineer=taret kuran dispanser kuran teleporter kuran bir mühendis tamamen savunma üzerinek kurulu bir karakter
demomen=hem defans hem atak üzerine kurulu psikopat iskoç arkadaşımız
özet:
genel olarak bu oyun beleş indirin ve oynayın emin olun bağımlısı olacaksınız saygılar sevgiler bu arada yorumumu beğenirseniz sevinirim saygılar.
i  like it it just needs more updates

Chess is a crappy tactical turn based RPG developed by a bunch of monkeys.
Right away you'll notice Chess has no storyline. Instead, all you notice is the the White army and the Black army are fighting each other over a battlefield. Note the "a battlefield," because Chess only has one story map.
As for the actual combat, it's extremely dull. Each unit can kill another with only one hit. This means units with a real good movement ability dominate the field (more on that bellow). There aren't even any combat animations or anything that happens in combat. One unit moves on it's space and "captures" it, and the piece is removed from the game with no form of action or special effects.
Yawn.
Chess has shitty class balance. The Queen is flat out overpowered while your actual front line units, the Pawns. can't do shit. I think the developers were afraid that no one would use the female character so they buffed up her abilities really high but now theres no point in using any other unit.
The rest of the units suck. Rooks can only move in 4 directions, same with Bishops. Boring. Also, whats up with the Knight? It has the most bizzare combat abilities of all the units. They're retardly hard to use cause they jump around like retards to move and attack. The devs should have named this unit Ninja, since Knights didn't jump around like that in real life.
Worst part, is the king. You see, the devs decided that if your king gets captured, you instantly lose the game. W-T-F? This wouldn't be a problem, except that he can't move for crap. Seriously, the most important unit in the game can only move 1 space a turn? Good luck keeping him alive while every other unit in the game dances around him.
Unbalanced classes, lackluster gameplay, and not to mention repetitive 1 hour+ games. Chess is not worth the time or your money. Buy Final Fantasy Tactics or Disgaea instead.
3 out of 10.

This is the cycle of every Team Fortress 2 player ever:

> Download the game.
> Enter your first match.
> Realize you don't know what you're doing.
> Die repeatedly.
> Just before you rage, you find the Ghastly Gibus hat.
> Since all the pro players have cool-looking hats, you are inspired.
> Die repeatedly in different game modes.
> Discover that you are getting a lot of kills as Pyro.
> Be mentally violated by other players calling you a "f2p gibus pyro".
> Get slightly better at the game.
> Die repeatedly.
> Leave the game.

*6 months later.*

> Start to discover TF2 videos on YouTube.
> Realize that there are more classes than just Pyro and Sniper.
> End up wanting to be a pro non-Pyro like all the cool YouTubers.
> Return to Team Fortress 2.
> Die repeatedly.
> Claim that you 'main' Pyro.
> Walk at people and light them on fire mindlessly for a few weeks. Or months.
> Start getting a good K/D ratio on a different class. (If it's Soldier, you can go die.)
> Succumb to peer-pressure and buy hats.
> Discover the Steam community market and buy more hats for less.
> Feel your skill strangely growing as you get more hats.
> More kills. Less deaths.
> You begin to discover the passive players of TF2. (Sandvich hoovies, spycrabs, box shpees, etc.)
> Develop a kindness and sense of friendship towards your fellow TF2 players.
> Start to top-score more often.
> You begin to care about the state of the game.
> Realize that Pyros are overpowered and pointless.
> Start to hate Pyros.
> Start to hate everyone.
> Start to hate the TF2 community.
> You hate everything and everyone, to the point where you start to kill passive players again.
> Ask yourself, "If I hate this game, why do I have ten unusuals and fifteen Australiums? What am I doing?"
> Look at your playtime and begin to hate yourself.
> You dislike yourself more than the game now.
> Contemplate suicide.
> Contemplate religion.
> Question the game.
> Binge-watch STAR_'s 2012-2013 TF2 videos to remind you of a simpler time.
> Sit down and think.
> Realize what you have become.
> Go into a mid-TF2 crisis.
> Except it's not mid-TF2 anymore. You have 1000 hours in-game.
> What is going on?
> WHAT IS TEAM FORTRESS 2?
> WHY DOES THE LIGHT LIE TO ME?
> Quit TF2 forever.
> Come back to it in a week and die to a gibus sniper who taunts after kill.
> Kill yourself.

Or maybe that was just my experience.
Oh well.

10/10

This was my first game that was not on a Nintendo console. The moment I played this game back in 2013 I was free from their chains. I went on to purchase at least 30 dollars of weapons and cosmetics, which was the greatest decision I made in this game. I have now moved on from PC to console, but I will look back at this game and smile while browsing the 5 games I have in my Steam library. God bless you, TF2, for opening my eyes and changing the way I look at games.

À première vu ce jeu ne me tentais vraiment pas surtout que je suis plutôt nul sur les fps (Enfin pas nul mais pas niveau compétitif quoi)

J'y avais joué y'a longtemps juste comme ça pour passer le temps, mais maintenant je m'y suis réellement mis et c'est un très bon fps facile à prendre en main, avec pas mal de succès, plusieurs mode de jeux dont un mode vs des machines (robots) 

Le jeu est gratuit, il n'est pas p2w. Vous pouvez acheter des skins mais aussi en gagner quelques un gratuitement (Même s'il ne sont pas très beau) 

J'ai mis 0$ sur Tf2 et je m'amuses beaucoup sur ce jeu contrairement à certains jeux qui sont très frustrant tf2 est un jeu qui détent, facile à enchainer les kills, plusieurs classes à jouer

Ceux qui hésites à se lancer sur ce jeu tout comme moi au début, aller y faire un tour ça vaux vraiment la peine. Les nombreux avis positifs vis à vis TF2 sont fondés ;)

Have fun

Team Fortress is one of the first games that I have ever gotten. I'm still relatively new to gaming as a whole but this game is so much fun to play. My boyfriend encouraged me to get it and now I'm a little addicted to playing this game and I haven't gotten bored yet. 

Also don't worry if your like me and playing games on a laptop, this game plays really well on it and is only ever effected by slow wifi speeds. Otherwise, this game is wonderful!
lol
Одна из лучших экшен игр от компании Valve(Volvo). Динамичный геймплей, звуковое оформление, визуальное оформление как героев так и их арсенала... Это и многое другое можно найти в этой игре!

EDIT: i gave this game a second chance, and after 447 hours later, it is still a stinky pee-brew of poor design choices. autobalance only unbalances teams and splits apart parties, leading to unenjoyable gameplay and people on your team revealing key information to their party members on the enemy team. expect stuff like being seen completely cloaked as a spy or having your securely hidden sentry nest found because some traitor on your team is spilling the beans over voicechat. valves VAC system does not work. the game has been riddled with hackers and bots, now recently more than ever with a new line of name changing aimbot sniper drones fresh of the shart-oven of some soy milk drinker in their sugar daddies basement coding all day. enemy has a hacker on their team? hope they have the good will to kick them, but chances are they would rather have the free win. have a hacker on your team? well be careful kicking them, or you may have up to 5 or more bots with your exact username join the game and try to kick you. the idea of sprays is interesting, except that you can only expect other people to load theirs up full of hentai, gore, topology equations, and other disgusting and mind harming images. the ingame report sytem wont save you, seeing as the game has been essentially abandoned by the developers in favor of Dota 2 (and for a period of time, Half-Life: Alyx), you shouldnt expect anyone you report to get away with even a slap on the wrist, no less an actual warning or ban. maybe when the hackers are done having their circlejerk and leave for another game like habbo hotel or something, we can come back to this game and have another chance at it. until then, stinky pee pee helmet.
